series.title: Envoy AI Gateway v0.3.x
series.subtitle: Release version introducing intelligent inference routing with Endpoint Picker Provider, Google Vertex AI support, and enhanced provider integrations.

releases.overview: Envoy AI Gateway v0.3.0 significantly expands the AI provider ecosystem while introducing intelligent inference routing capabilities. This release brings Google Vertex AI and Anthropic on Vertex AI from experimental to production-ready status, introduces Endpoint Picker Provider support for dynamic load balancing, and enhances the overall provider integration experience with improved tooling and streaming support.

items.title: Gateway API Inference Extension Support
items.description: Complete integration with Gateway API Inference Extension v0.5.1, enabling intelligent endpoint selection based on real-time AI inference metrics like KV-cache usage, queue depth, and LoRA adapter information.

items.title: Dual Integration Approaches
items.description: Support for both HTTPRoute + InferencePool and AIGatewayRoute + InferencePool integration patterns, providing flexibility for different use cases from simple to advanced AI routing scenarios.

items.title: Dynamic Load Balancing
items.description: Intelligent routing that automatically selects the optimal inference endpoint for each request, optimizing resource utilization across your entire inference infrastructure with real-time performance metrics.

items.title: Extensible Architecture
items.description: Support for custom endpoint picker providers, allowing implementation of domain-specific routing logic tailored to unique AI workload requirements.

items.title: Google Vertex AI Production Support
items.description: Google Vertex AI has moved from work-in-progress to full production support, including complete streaming support for Gemini models with OpenAI API compatibility. View all supported providers →

items.title: Anthropic on Vertex AI Integration
items.description: Complete Anthropic Claude integration via GCP Vertex AI, moving from experimental to production-ready status with multi-tool support and configurable API versions for enterprise deployments.

items.title: Enhanced Gemini Capabilities
items.description: Improved request/response translation for Gemini models with support for tools, response format specification, and advanced conversation handling, making Gemini integration more robust and feature-complete.

items.title: Strengthened OpenAI-Compatible Ecosystem
items.description: Enhanced support for the broader OpenAI-compatible provider ecosystem including Groq, Together AI, Mistral, Cohere, DeepSeek, SambaNova, and more, ensuring seamless integration across the AI provider landscape.

items.title: Model Name Virtualization
items.description: Added a new modelNameOverride field in the backend reference in AIGateawayRoute, allowing for a flexible way to configure a 'virtual' model name for routing purposes.View the documentation →

items.title: non-LLM HTTPRoute Support
items.description: Now you can attach normal HTTPRoutes as well as AIGatewayRoutes to one Gateway object, allowing for a unified routing configuration that supports both AI and non-AI traffic.

apiChanges.title: BackendSecurityPolicy TargetRefs
apiChanges.description: Added targetRefs field to BackendSecurityPolicy spec, enabling direct targeting of AIServiceBackend resources using Gateway API policy attachment patterns.

apiChanges.title: Gateway API Inference Extension
apiChanges.description: Allows InferencePool resource of Gateway API Inference Extension v0.5.1 to be specified as a backend ref in AIGatewayRoute intelligent endpoint selection.

apiChanges.title: modelNameOverride in the backend reference of AIGatewayRoute
apiChanges.description: Added modelNameOverride field in the backend reference of AIGatewayRoute, allowing for flexible model name rewrite for routing purposes.

deprecations.title: backendSecurityPolicyRef Pattern
deprecations.description: The old pattern of AIServiceBackend referencing BackendSecurityPolicy is deprecated in favor of the new targetRefs approach. Existing configurations will continue to work but should be migrated before v0.4.

deprecations.title: AIGatewayRoute's targetRefs Pattern
deprecations.description: The targetRefs pattern is no longer supported for AIGatewayRoute. Existing configurations will continue to work but should be migrated to parentRefs.

deprecations.title: controller.envoyGatewayNamespace helm value is no longer necessary
deprecations.description: This value is no longer necessary and is redundant when configured.

deprecations.title: AIGatewayRoute's schema Field
deprecations.description: The schema field is no longer needed for AIGatewayRoute. Existing configurations will continue to work but should be removed before v0.4.
